rules.natural: If wheat futures are profitable, then they are an attractive investment.
Whenever a margin call is issued for wheat futures, forced liquidation follows.
In the event of forced liquidation for wheat futures, trading is suspended.
Either an export ban is imposed on wheat futures or an import quota is set for them.
Assuming an import quota is set for wheat futures, they are an attractive investment.
Provided that a trade war escalates for wheat futures, trade restrictions are tightened.
If technical analysis is bullish for wheat futures, then, given a drought in the Midwest region, high demand leads to profitability.
Either technical analysis is bullish for wheat futures or fundamental analysis is bullish.
Wheat futures have high demand or low supply.
If the government intervenes in wheat futures, a subsidy is announced.
Either the government intervenes in wheat futures or the central bank acts.

Should the central bank act on wheat futures, then either market sentiment is bearish or, if expert consensus is bullish, then fundamental analysis being bullish, with a drought in the Midwest region and high demand, leads to profitability.

In the event price support is implemented for wheat futures, either market sentiment is bearish or, if expert consensus is bullish, then fundamental analysis being bullish, with a drought in the Midwest region and high demand, results in profitability.
Provided a subsidy is announced for wheat futures, price support is implemented.
If seasonal demand is high for wheat futures, then high demand leads to profitability.
In the case of low supply for wheat futures, they are profitable.
Either a transportation strike affects wheat futures or port closures do.
Provided port closures affect wheat futures, then a disrupted supply chain leads to the price not being stable.
If a logistics crisis affects wheat futures, then a transportation strike causing a supply chain disruption results in the price not being stable.
Assuming infrastructure failure affects wheat futures, then a transportation strike leading to a supply chain disruption implies the price is not stable.
Either the weather forecast is good for wheat futures or, if it is poor, the supply chain is not functional.
Provided tariffs are increased for wheat futures, international trade is not active.
Assuming import duties are raised for wheat futures, tariffs are increased.
Whenever a drought occurs in the Midwest region, the wheat crop has a damaged harvest.
Should trade policy shift for wheat futures, then tightened trade restrictions lead to raised import duties.
If the wheat crop fails, then high demand results in profitability for wheat futures.
Provided the wheat crop has reduced yield, it fails.
In the event the wheat crop has a damaged harvest, it has reduced yield.
Provided it is false that an export ban imposition leads to wheat futures being an attractive investment, then domestic supply is not secure.
Should it not be true that a trade war escalation results in international trade not being active, then diplomatic relations are stable.
If neither a logistics crisis nor infrastructure failure affects wheat futures, then the supply chain is functional.
Provided it is false that market volatility leads to the price not being stable, a margin call is issued.
If it is not the case that market volatility results in the price not being stable, then trading is not suspended.
Should it be false that the negation of an export ban making wheat futures attractive implies domestic supply security, then international trade is active.
Assuming it is not true that the failure of an export ban to make wheat futures attractive leads to domestic supply security, then a trade war escalates.
If seasonal demand is not high for wheat futures, then it is low.
Provided seasonal demand is not high for wheat futures, it is not low.
Should wheat futures not be an attractive investment, then the price is stable.
